org.jmol.util

Class Vector3f

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jmol.util.Tuple3f
      • org.jmol.util.Vector3f
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Vector3f
extends Tuple3f
    A 3-element vector that is represented by single precision floating point x,y,z coordinates. If this value represents a normal, then it should be normalized.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Fields inherited from class org.jmol.util.Tuple3f

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float angle(Vector3f v1)
      Returns the angle in radians between this vector and the vector parameter; the return value is constrained to the range [0,PI].
      void cross(Vector3f v1, Vector3f v2)
      Sets this vector to be the vector cross product of vectors v1 and v2.
      float dot(Vector3f v)
      Computes the dot product of the this vector and vector v.
      float length()
      Returns the length of this vector.
      float lengthSquared()
      Returns the squared length of this vector.
      static Vector3f new3(float x, float y, float z) 
      static Vector3f newV(Tuple3f t) 
      void normalize()
      Normalizes this vector in place.
